cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 420 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida and 430 miles SW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northeast today, accelerate toward the northwest Florida Big Bend, cross the Florida Peninsula, and then move offshore into the Atlantic along the U.S. southeast coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Big Bend / northwest Florida coast between Anclote River and Indian Pass

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Anclote River to Indian Pass; Tropical Storm Watch west of Indian Pass to the Walton/Bay County line (all on the Gulf coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast of Florida Big Bend for landfall, then the entire Florida Peninsula and U.S. southeast coast for rain and wind
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with isolated tropical-storm-force gusts possible; sustained gale-force winds are unlikely (≤8% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor Atlantic coastal surge under 2 ft possible; significant surge (>3 ft) not expected at the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Thursday night into Friday with 4–6 inches possible, producing ponding and localized flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along the southeast Florida Atlantic coast.
